item.title: Ghost of Yotei May Not Be Exactly 'Ghost of Tsushima 2', But It Doesn't Mean Jin is Done For
item.description:
There were a lot of exciting announcements at the recent State of Play, but Ghost of Yotei definitely stole the show. News of a sequel to Ghost of Tsushima has been long-awaited, but Ghost of Yotei took many by surprise. Not only is the game set over 300 years after the events of its predecessor, but it's introducing a brand-new protagonist.

Atsu, a female Ronin, takes the stage as Ghost of Yotei 's lead. It was both a shocking and thrilling revelation, but there has also been sadness in regard to Jin Sakai being taken out of the picture. Much of the speculation surrounding a sequel predicted that a follow-up would revolve around the second Mongol invasion of Japan that happened only a few years after the first. Sucker Punch making the bold decision to make the Ghost of Tsushima franchise more of an anthology is ultimately a stronger move, but that doesn't mean Jin Sakai is completely gone as a character.

Ghost of Yotei Still Leaves Room For Jin Sakai's Presence

Bringing a New Meaning to the Ghost of Tsushima Name

With Ghost of Yotei taking place 300 years after its predecessor, Jin is clearly dead. However, this doesn't mean he can't live on in some capacity. Jin's story and the events of Ghost of Tsushima have likely become legends that are passed down from generation to generation, making Jin a folk hero. He can still live on through stories, and this presents plenty of opportunities for the character to be mentioned and hinted at during various points in Ghost of Yotei 's story.

Whether it be through interactions with descendants or writings found throughout the game, Jin can still be an important presence, even if he is not physically there. Showcasing a new region and era of Japan is an intriguing change, and it could be fascinating to see how Jin's story has evolved through word-of-mouth storytelling. Despite many decades passing since Ghost of Tsushima , Jin's efforts to push back the Mongols wouldn't be forgotten. There is even the possibility that Atsu could potentially be a descendant of Jin. Since the announcement of the sequel is fresh, there is barely anything known about the character, but being part of Jin's lineage isn't off the table.

Ghost of Yotei takes place in the Ezo region in 1603. At the time, this was an area outside of Japan's rule.

It would also be a beautiful way to pay homage to the franchise's "ghost" title if Jin were to subtly haunt the story in some small way. A Sucker Punch dev has hinted that Ghost of Yotei may be the first of many spin-off stories. Creating a chain reaction of each preceding protagonist touching the story in an unexpected way may be a smart way to make the games feel connected while also standing on their own.

Ghost of Yotei is a Bold and Promising Choice

Sucker Punch Taking Chances

Ghost of Tshusima and Ghost of Yotei setting the stage for a new ongoing PlayStation franchise shows that Sucker Punch isn't afraid to take risks, and that's exciting. The developer could have easily gone the expected route and featured the second Mongol invasion, but it chose fresh storytelling over the clear path forward. Although Ghost of Yotei 's appearance matches its predecessor, it's clear that the game also aims to be its own special stand-alone story.

Despite controversy surrounding Ghost of Yotei 's new protagonist, Atsu and her story are promising another beautiful and violent adventure on the horizon. Sucker Punch has shocked many with this change of direction, and it could pay off in spades if the story is on par, or even better, than its predecessor. Jin may be physically long gone, but his spirit will likely still be present.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Blazewood HIA Commemorative Coin Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Blazewood HIA Commemorative Coin Locations In ZZZ
  • Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Morning Time
  • Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Afternoon Time
  • Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Evening Time
  • Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Midnight Time

While exploring the cities in Zenless Zone Zero , players will come across peculiar entities, such as Officer Mewmew, whose identity is still a mystery, and the Sage in a Barrel , which is even more absurd than the large white cat. Kicking this trash can will cause the Sage in a Barrel to request some HIA Commemorative Coins in ZZZ . There are several types of this item, and the Sage will request different types based on where players are interacting with the trash can.

For example, in Lumina Square, the garbage bin will ask for HIA Commemorative Coins Radiance in Zenless Zone Zero . Meanwhile, in the Outer Ring's Blazewood, the Sage in a Barrel asks for HIA Commemorative Coins - Blazewood in ZZZ .

Blazewood HIA Commemorative Coin Locations In ZZZ

Before Proxies can collect HIA Commemorative Coins in Blazewood in ZZZ , they must first interact with the Sage in the Barrel . Teleport to Blazewood - Lower Level , then walk forward a little bit. The Sage in the Barrel should be on your right, next to broken vending machines .

Teleport out of Blazewood then return to reset the map after each coin is obtained to avoid changing time frequently. Returning to login screen may also work.

Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Morning Time

There are three Blazewood HIA Commemorative Coins in the morning:

  1. Teleport to Officer Mewmew in ZZZ , then turn right to approach a motorcycle. Talk to the person with a gray speech bubble to get one HIA Coin for Blazewood.
  2. Warp to the Lower Level, then approach the two people talking. Next, go to Officer Mewmew and speak with Leigh to get two Blazewood HIA Coins.

Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Afternoon Time

Teleport to Officer Mewmew then look at the orange house to your right . Speak with the child (Shawn) near the house, then talk to Leif near the stairs. He’ll give you two Blazewood HIA Coins.

Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Evening Time

There are four HIA Commemorative Coins in Blazewood during the evening. To get the first two, follow these steps:

  1. Go to the Lower Level, then turn around to find Bolter next to the elevator.
  2. Turn around and walk straight to Shawn near the yellow stairs and an RV. Report back to Bolter.
  3. Teleport away from Blazewood and come back to reset the map.
  4. Go to Cheesetopia and talk to Bolter.
  5. Head to the Lower Level and interact with Lola at Shawn’s previous location.

To get the other two HIA Coins in Blazewood, go talk to Stevia in Cheesetopia building. Afterward, speak with Old Demir in front of Cheesetopia, by the cactus.

If Stevia doesn’t appear after several reset attempts, try to complete the following missions:

  1. Talk to Ono near Old Demir at the Lower Level and complete the Wilderness Pursuit combat commission (Chapter 4).
  2. Change to morning time, then talk to Appon at the Lower Level.
  3. Complete Appon’s exploration commission in ZZZ , Redemption in the Rock Quarry .
  4. Change to morning time again, then speak to Appon at the Lower Level.
  5. Teleport away from Blazewood, fast-forward to evening, then return to Cheesetopia.

Blazewood HIA Coins In ZZZ - Midnight Time

For the final Blazewood HIA Commemorative Coin, go to the Sage in the Barrel at midnight and speak to the nearby NPC.

item.title: Remnant 2: Where To Find Detonating Cord
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Detonating Cord Location One: Agronomy Sector North
  • Detonating Cord Location Two: Agronomy Sector East

Remant 2 The Dark Horizon DLC brought a pile of new equipment, weapons, and accessories to wear. Among all of these, the Detonating Cord is one that will surely change the meta of the game, opening the possibilities for some great AoE builds.

First things first: players need to find this ring, and with Remnant 2 's procedural map generation, that can be tricky. But don't worry; this guide narrows down the location of this ring to two possible locations in the Agronomy Sector in N'erud. Players looking for this powerful accessory should start The Dark Horizon one-shot adventure, then pick up this guide from there.

Detonating Cord Location One: Agronomy Sector North

From the starting checkpoint of the Dark Horizon Agronomy Sector map, players should go north until they find a fork. Then, they should choose the path leading further north and pick up the first drone that will pop up from the platform.

If players direct the gliding Drone toward the hot air stream that's in front, they'll be propelled upward, to a platform located one level above the ledge. This platform will be big enough to have two of those big orange lamps illuminating the crops, and one Harvester will be patrolling the area. Defeat the Harvester, climb the ledge on the left side, and then an Amalgam will appear.

Players can use the streams of hot air to maintain the gliding drone for longer periods, but if they wish to descend, they can press the 'Crouch' key. That way, they can prevent going beyond the landing point and control their descent.

This elite enemy can be a little tricky to deal with, so equipping a resilient melee build with a tank Archetype can help players with the non-stop blows they'll receive from this beast. It doesn't have too much health, so a couple of primary weapon magazines unloaded in its weak point (the shiny orange thing in its head) will do the trick.

After that, players will notice a purplish glow on the floor next to an orange lamp. There, they'll find the Detonating Cord lying on the floor .

Detonating Cord Location Two: Agronomy Sector East

From the second Checkpoint, turn east and pick up the drone right next to Spark , the friendly Surveyor Robot with a knack for poetry. Players will notice two ledges in front of them: the one below leads to the entrance of the Stagnant Manufactory, so players should land on the one placed higher , with all the crops and the orange lamps glowing.

​​​​

Once they land, players have to run up the hill and battle a Harvester that is safeguarding some crops and patrolling the area. Once they defeat it, they can climb toward a middle section between the two ledges. There, they'll see a body on the ground holding a purple item. That's the Detonating Cord.

The Detonator Mutator collected from the Astral Harvester Boss synergizes particularly well with the Detonating Cord , empowering its Explosive Damage rounds and the area damage caused by its triggered effect.

The Detonating Cord grants a new effect that buffs Explosive Damage by 10% and lasts 15 seconds. At the same time, it causes an explosion dealing 362.5 base damage around the player. This damage can scale with Explosive Damage buffs, such as the one activated by the Detonating Cord, and other accessories and Traits with similar effects.

item.title: Remnant 2: How to Get Black Greatsword
item.description:
The Black Greatsword is a Melee Weapon in Remnant 2 that was added to the game alongside the release of The Dark Horizon DLC. While this sword may not be the best Melee Weapon in the game, some players will undoubtedly be interested in adding it to their arsenals. For those players who would like to get their hands on the Black Greatsword in Remnant 2 , this guide explains exactly how it is obtained.

While the Black Greatsword was added to the game alongside the release of The Dark Horizon DLC, some players report that they have been able to obtain the weapon without purchasing the DLC. As such, the Black Greatsword may not be a DLC-exclusive weapon, and it could instead be part of the free update that added Remnant 2 's Prism system .

Remnant 2: How to Get Black Greatsword

Craft Alpha/Omega Long Gun

The first step toward obtaining the Black Greatsword is creating the Alpha/Omega Long Gun . For the uninitiated, that weapon is crafted McCabe in Ward 13, and it requires a Forgotten Memory . To obtain a Forgotten Memory, players must defeat Annihilation , Remnant 2 's final boss.

Get Black Metal Bars

After crafting Alpha/Omega, players should make their way to Ward 13's firing range, speak with Brabus , and buy every weapon that he has for sale. If a player does not have enough Scraps to purchase all of Barbus's weapons, they may want to pursue the strategy detailed in this guide to farming Scraps in Remnant 2 .

Once all the weapons have been purchased, players should speak with Barbus again and listen to his new dialogue. At the end of this dialogue, fans will receive the Black Metal Bars , an item that plays a key role in obtaining the Black Greatsword.

Give Black Metal Bars to McCabe

With the Black Metal Bars in hand, Remnant 2 players should talk to McCabe in her workroom in Ward 13 and select the "I have something for you to look at" dialogue option. This action will ultimately lead to giving the Black Metal Bars to McCabe, and she will indicate that she needs some time to tinker with the material.

Wait & Return to McCabe

Players should now fast travel out of Ward 13 and then fast travel back to it. Upon returning to Ward 13, players should talk to McCabe and select the "is it done" dialogue option to receive the Black Greatsword Melee Weapon.

item.title: PS Plus Extra Adds One of the Best PlayStation Games Ever Made
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • PS Plus Extra now includes The Last of Us Part 1.
  • The Last of Us Part 1 is the PS5 remake of the classic PS3 game.
  • The game is also available for PS Plus Premium subscribers to play.

The Extra tier of the PlayStation Plus subscription service has been updated to include The Last of Us Part 1 , the PS5 remake of one of the best PlayStation games ever made. PlayStation Plus Extra is the middle tier of Sony's subscription service. With it, subscribers can claim the monthly free PS Plus games, as well as try all the titles added to the Games Catalog.

The PS Plus Games Catalog is a collection of PS4 and PS5 games that are available on a rotating basis. Some of the best games ever released for either platform are readily available to play through PS Plus Extra, and so for many PlayStation gamers, the subscription is really a no-brainer. Yet another game has been added to the PS Plus Extra lineup, giving gamers even more reason to sign up.

To celebrate The Last of Us Day, PlayStation has added The Last of Us Part 1 to PS Plus Extra. The Last of Us Part 1 is the PS5 remake of The Last of Us , Naughty Dog's critically-acclaimed action-adventure/survival-horror game that originally released on the PS3 in 2013. The Last of Us Part 1 vastly improves the game's graphics to match modern standards and takes advantage of new features like the DualSense's adaptive triggers and haptic feedback. It's the best way to experience the story of the original Last of Us game nowadays, and now PS Plus Extra subscribers can do just that without paying more than what they already do with their subscription.

The Last of Us Part 1 Joins PS Plus Extra

The Last of Us Part 1 is just the latest game added to PS Plus Extra in the month of September 2024. The other new PS Plus Extra games for September 2024 were added last week and included day one game The Plucky Squire , Under the Waves , Night in the Woods , Chernobylite , Wild Card Football , Space Engineers , Road 96 , Ben 10 , and Far Cry 5 . Another batch of PS Plus Extra games are expected to be added to the service in the middle of October, and so on and so forth.

Of course, anyone signed up for the Premium tier of PS Plus gets access to The Last of Us Part 1 and all the other games added to PS Plus Extra this month. Premium subscribers get everything that PS Plus has to offer, plus a selection of retro games. In fact, it was just recently confirmed that classic PS1 games Blood Omen: Legacy of Kain and Dino Crisis are coming to PS Plus Premium at some piont in the near future.
